meanings.definition: inheritrixes (noun): plural form of inheritrix, a female heir
meanings.sent1: The inheritrixes were thrilled to receive their grandmother's antique jewelry.
meanings.sent2: The inheritrixes of the estate were her three daughters.
meanings.sent3: The inheritrixes couldn't decide who got to keep the family cat.
meanings.sent4: The inheritrixes of the ancient kingdom held great power and responsibility.
meanings.sent5: The inheritrixes eagerly awaited the reading of the will to see what they would receive.

meanings.definition: inheritrixes (verb): third person singular present of inheritrix, to inherit as a female heir
meanings.sent1: She inheritrixes the family estate after her mother passed away.
meanings.sent2: He inheritrixes the title of Duke upon his father's death.
meanings.sent3: The princess inheritrixes the enchanted castle and all its magical secrets.
